ui
Class ZenTerminal

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          ui.ZenTerminal
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
public class ZenTerminal
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

Zen Terminal is the HttpServlet for the Simulator application. It is the connection between the jsp front end and the java servlet back end.

It uses the doGet to return Positions of trips and doPost to handle input from the jsp front end The other methods in the class are actions to be relayed to the simulator from the front end There can only be one simulator running no matter the ammount of front ends using it.

Version:
April 2010
Author:
Jorge Alexis Hernandez
See Also:

Method Detail

doGet

public void doGet(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
           throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                  java.io.IOException
doGet is used to obtain the positions from the simulator relayed to the front end.

it generates a PrintWriter object and it associates it to the HttpSerlvletResponse and writes the positions to it, this way the positions are relayed to the requesting http front end

Overrides:
doGet in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
Parameters:
request - the request from the front end
response - the response to be relayed back to the front end
Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException
java.io.IOException

doPost

public void doPost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
            throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                   java.io.IOException
doPost is called from the http or in this case ajax front end to interface with the simulator

This communication is regulated by a set of functions, the method checks the input in the request and calls the appropriate functions to handle the following requests.

  • stop
  • play
  • pause
  • step
  • refresh
  • per
it responds to these requests by calling the similarly named methods

Overrides:
doPost in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
Parameters:
request - the request from the front end
response - the response to be relayed back to the front end
Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException
java.io.IOException

getPositions

public void getPositions(java.io.PrintWriter o)

prints none if the simulkator is not started
